intro: Codonandra coroensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Codonandra coroensis plays an important role in the ecological and cultural landscape of Hawaii.
